text: Neptune Blood was a 17th-century Anglican priest in Ireland."A New History of Ireland" T. W. Moody, F. X. Martin, F.J. Byrne and Cosgrove, A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 Blood was educated at Trinity College, Dublin."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593–1860George Dames Burtchaell/Thomas Ulick Sadleir p76: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 He was ordained a priest on 12 March 1622. A Prebendary of Rath at Killaloe Cathedral, "Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p495 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 he was Archdeacon of Kilfenora from 1641Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (Third Edition, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. pp. 360–361 to 1663."Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. pp511/12 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 He was Dean of Kilfenora from 1663 to 1692; and Vicar general from 1676."Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p506 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 His son was Dean of Kilfenora from 1692 until 1716.Alumni Dublinenses (ibid): FEH V1 p506 (ibid) ==References== Category:Deans of Kilfenora Category:Archdeacons of Kilfenora Category:1692 deaths Category:17th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin
title: Neptune Blood
